author: NICOLE BITETTE
title: Bill Paxton will not be recast in TV remake of 'Training Day'
text:
Bill Paxton's role in TV remake of 'Training Day' will not be recast, producers say Bill Paxton will not be recast in TV remake of 'Training Day' Bill Paxton as Frank Rourke in CBS’s “Training Day.” (Paul Sarkis/WARNER BROS.)   8:03 AM 
Bill Paxton is irreplaceable in his "Training Day" role. 
Producers of the CBS series say they will not recast the actor following his unexpected death on Saturday at age 61. 
Creator Will Beall told TMZ that there's "no way" they will recast the iconic actor. 
Beall and executive producer Barry Schindel told the gossip site that the send-off for Paxton's character in the season finale is really beautiful. Remembering the life and career of Bill Paxton 
"We are really proud of it," Beall said. 
Schindel told the gossip site that he had spoken to the "Twister" star the day before his surgery and that he seemed in good spirits. 
"He was really proud and excited about the show," Schindel said. Actor Bill Paxton in 2015. The star died on Saturday due to complications from surgery. (© Mario Anzuoni / Reuters/REUTERS) 
Paxton had wrapped Season 1 of the made-for-TV remake of the 2001 police drama film back in December, a publicity manager for "Training Day," told the Daily News . 
Four episodes of "Training Day" have already aired and it is unclear when the rest will debut. 
Paxton, who starred in some of the biggest blockbusters of the 1980s and '90s, died unexpectedly due to complications from surgery.
